com.threecrickets.prudence.service
Class ApplicationService

java.lang.Object
  com.threecrickets.prudence.service.ApplicationService

public class ApplicationService
extends Object

Application service exposed to executables.

Author:
Tal Liron

Method Detail

getApplication

public Application getApplication()
The underlying application.

Returns:
The application

getComponent

public Component getComponent()
The underlying component.

Note: for this to work, the component must have been explicitly set as attribute com.threecrickets.prudence.component in the application's context.

Returns:
The component

getGlobals

public ConcurrentMap<String,Object> getGlobals()
A map of all values global to the current application.

Returns:
The globals

getGlobal

public Object getGlobal(String name,
                        Object defaultValue)
Gets a value global to the current application, atomically setting it to a default value if it doesn't exist.

Parameters:
name - The name of the global
defaultValue - The default value
Returns:
The global's current value

getSharedGlobals

public ConcurrentMap<String,Object> getSharedGlobals()
A map of all values global to all running applications.

Note that this could be null if shared globals are not set up.

Returns:
The shared globals or null
See Also:
getComponent()

getSharedGlobal

public Object getSharedGlobal(String name,
                              Object defaultValue)
Gets a value global to all running applications, atomically setting it to a default value if it doesn't exist.

If shared globals are not set up, does nothing and returns null.

Parameters:
name - The name of the shared global
defaultValue - The default value
Returns:
The shared global's current value
See Also:
getComponent()

getDistributedGlobals

public ConcurrentMap<String,Object> getDistributedGlobals()
A map of all values global to the Prudence Hazelcast cluster.

This is simply the "com.threecrickets.prudence.distributedGlobals" Hazelcast map.

Returns:
The distributed globals or null

getDistributedGlobal

public Object getDistributedGlobal(String name,
                                   Object defaultValue)
Gets a value global to the Prudence Hazelcast cluster, atomically setting it to a default value if it doesn't exist.

If distributed globals are not set up, does nothing and returns null.

Parameters:
name - The name of the distributed global
defaultValue - The default value
Returns:
The distributed global's current value

getLogger

public Logger getLogger()
The application's logger.

Returns:
The logger
See Also:
getSubLogger(String)

getSubLogger

public Logger getSubLogger(String name)
A logger with a name appended with a "." to the application's logger name. This allows inheritance of configuration.

Parameters:
name - The sub-logger name
Returns:
The logger
See Also:
getLogger()

getMediaType

public MediaType getMediaType(String name)
Get a media type by its MIME type name.

Parameters:
name - The MIME type name
Returns:
The media type

getExecutor

public ExecutorService getExecutor()
Gets the shared executor service, creating one if it doesn't exist.

If shared globals are not set up, gets the application's executor service.

This setting can be configured by setting an attribute named com.threecrickets.prudence.executor in the component's Context.

Returns:
The executor service

task

public <T> Future<T> task(String applicationName,
                          String documentName,
                          String entryPointName,
                          Object context,
                          int delay,
                          int repeatEvery,
                          boolean fixedRepeat)
Submits or schedules an ApplicationTask on the the shared executor service.

Parameters:
applicationName - The application's full name, or null to default to current application's name
documentName - The document name
entryPointName - The entry point name or null
context - The context made available to the task
delay - Initial delay in milliseconds, or zero for ASAP
repeatEvery - Repeat delay in milliseconds, or zero for no repetition
fixedRepeat - Whether repetitions are at fixed times, or if the repeat delay begins when the task ends
Returns:
A future for the task
See Also:
getExecutor()

distributedTask

public <T> Future<T> distributedTask(String applicationName,
                                     String documentName,
                                     String entryPointName,
                                     Object context,
                                     Object where,
                                     boolean multi)
Submits a task on the Hazelcast cluster.

Parameters:
applicationName - The application's full name, or null to default to current application's name
documentName - The document name
entryPointName - The entry point name or null
context - The context made available to the task (must be serializable)
where - A Member, an iterable of Member, any other object (the member key), or null to let Hazelcast decide
multi - Whether the task should be executed on all members in the set
Returns:
A future for the task
See Also:
Hazelcast.getExecutorService()
